channel.title: NEED HELP ASAP:d
channel.description:
[b]Hey guys! im new at coding(dont judge) :D and i really need help how to fix this rofl!!! it just has to do with adding shops, wont take to much of your time! (: thanks guys! [/b] [code=java]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "5 5 gear" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at ShopHandler.loadShops(ShopHandler.java:115) at ShopHandler.<init>(ShopHandler.java:30) at server.main(server.java:30)[/code] [b][size=12pt] this is what it says , not when i compile but when i "runserver" and if any of you think u have the time or chance to maybe teach to to code just basic stuff pm me :) thanks a lot guys!!! [/size][/b]
[b]btw this is what i have in shops.cfg, client.java, and autospawn[/b]
for shops i have [code=java]shop = 55 gear 1 1 4151 10 1050 1 11694 1[/code] in client.java i have [code=html4strict]else if (NPCID == 1917) { // gear PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 55; }[/code] and in autospawn i have [code=java]spawn = 1917 3093 3493 0 0 0 0 0 1 bandit shopkeeper[/code]

item.title: NEED HELP ASAP:d
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

No problem at all Dylan. Always here to help. They usually have a parameter within CFG files which does not need to be commented out. But you are correct by assuming all non-java language needs to be commented out.

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP ASAP:d
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

Just search for “second”. Usually throughout different servers methods will be named different things. Just generalize the name until you find something similar to what you’re after

Null means empty or nothing. For example, if you try to find something that does not exist, it will return a null. Because there is nothing there.

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP ASAP:d
item.dc:creator: @mock_pro mock pro
item.description:
@mock_pro wrote:

ohh thanks man! and what do u happen to know about “nulls” i know it has to do with client/cache area right???

oh and the “void SecondClickNpc()” it says it can’t find it in client.java

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP ASAP:d
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

Oh that is a different type of problem. ALOT of servers are like that. It’s not a big problem.

else if (NPCID == 1917) { // gear PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 55;}

Press ctrl+F in your client.java.

Find: void SecondClickNpc()

Then under there add that same code as show above. That should do the trick.

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP ASAP:d
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

If it’s adding a shop, or doing something to a shop that you’re doing, make sure that it matches the other shops. Make sure that the spacing and number of items match other shops exactly. To me it seems like something to do with the layout.

Read full topic
